q: Andy Coulson has withstood months of strain over allegations-- which he denies-- that while editor at the News of the World he encouraged reporters to hack the cellphone messages of royals, politicians and celebrities. Unfortunately, continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in this role, Andy Coulson said in a statement confirming his resignation. "I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman, it's time to move on."

Aaron Rodgers : I think a number of reasons: one, I wasn't, you know-- even today, I'm not gon na be the guy who pops out as-- you know, I'm not 6' 5, I'm not 240, I'm don't run a 4-5-40. But I think a lot of times, the things you can't measure are often the things that give people the most success."
